question: 積もる
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>accumulate</kanji> and the verb version is <vocabulary>to accumulate</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: If something accumulates, you can start with one, but you need at least <reading>two</reading> (<ja>つ</ja>) things to say it has accumulated. If you don't, then there's nothing accumulating at all.
